titleStmt.title: L. Eckley et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG9184

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excellency
Jas F Robinson Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned Citizens of Powell County would represent to your excellency that at the present term of Powell Circuit Court David P. Rose was find twenty Dollars for illigal. gaming. committed as follows for betting and quart of whiskey upon a chicken fight

we would say to your excellency that Mr Rose is a good Moral Citizen not in the habit of betting or gaming in any way whatever. and is a poor Man with a large family. and if he has said fine or Judgment it will be very oppressive upon him. we would ask your excellency to remit said Judgment or fine

L. Eckley Jur
George Nobrow Jur
John Holmes, Jur
Jas M Mansfield Jury
P L Berry jury
Wm Battershell Jury
J. S Dury Comth Atty.
M Stewart Jury
Samel S Forman Jure
Wm Bowen Jury
G,, B,, Wills Jury
Wm Caens Jury
L A. Glover Juryman

Powell Ct Ct
vs
D P Owens Rose
